revised_title: Description and Analysis of a Large Calculus Found in a Mare
tldr: A large calculus was found in a mare's abdomen, and its properties and origin were studied. The stone was composed of different layers and had a specific gravity similar to that of water. It was the largest stone of its kind observed, and the mare was able to work normally despite its presence until a few months before her death. The stone's discovery and analysis are described in detail, along with comparisons to other similar cases.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Veterinary Medicine
